medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The infant was born well and normocalcemic at birth but was readmitted to hospital at 7 days of age with focal seizures affecting her upper limbs. Investigations revealed a low serum calcium of 1.57 mmol/L and elevated phosphate levels.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The infant experienced hypocalcemia and seizures secondary to transient neonatal hypoparathyroidism. Maternal hypercalcemia due to familial hypocalciuric hypercalcemia type 1 (FHH1) likely contributed to these symptoms.
medical_history.family_history: The mother has familial hypocalciuric hypercalcemia type 1 (FHH1), and the child's family history includes hypercalcemic individuals, indicating a hereditary condition.
